body.name: TP-Link Powerline Wi-Fi Extender (TL-WPA7617KIT) - AV1000 Powerline Ethernet Adapter with AC1200 Dual Band Wi-Fi, Gigabit Port, Passthrough, OneMesh, Ethernet Over Power, Plug & Play
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Quality Photo and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 12 hrs 16 mins
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 12 hrs 16 mins
features: Homeplug AV2 Standard Compliant Powerline Adapter - Provides up to 1000Mbps Ethernet over power and up to dual band 1200mbps(300mbps 2.4Ghz plus 867mbps 5GHz) Wireless internet. Ideal to be an Ethernet extender which can easily go over walls
One-Touch Wi-Fi Configuration - One press of the Wi-Fi button copies the network name and password from your router. Any setting changes will be automatically applied to the entire powerline network
Gigabit Ethernet Port - Provide secure wired network to desktop, smart TVs, or game consoles
Plug, Pair and Play - Quickly set up a secured powerline network with no configuration required to enjoy fast, seamless wired/ wireless connection in minutes
OneMesh Compatible - Works with TP-Link OneMesh router to form a unified mesh network for seamless streaming while moving around your home
Extra Power Socket - Get power from the outlet for your other devices with the integrated power socket
Please note that powerline adapters must be deployed in sets of two or more

Kindly Reminder: Powerline Adapters must be on the same electrical circuit for connectivity. Requires direct outlet plug in. Does not work with surge protectors. Appliances and devices running on the same circuit may affect powerline performance.
body.description: The Homeplug AV2 compliant powerline TL-WPA7617KIT extends your network with fast wired speeds with Wi-Fi speeds up to 300 Mbps on 2.4GHz and 867 Mbps on 5GHz. It is perfect for smart TVs, game consoles, HD video streaming, or lag-free gaming. Set up your powerline network with no configuration required to start enjoying fast, seamless wired and wireless connection in minutes.The terms “AV1000” and “1000Mbps” are derived from applicable specifications and refer to the theoretical maximum physical-layer data transfer rate. Those terms are used on this product solely to indicate its compatibility with other “AV1000” or “1000Mbps” powerline devices. Actual data speeds vary and may be limited by the product’s Ethernet port and other network conditions such as data traffic, electrical noise, and wiring issues. For better performance, powerline devices should be deployed on the same electrical circuit and rated for the same HomePlug standard. A minimum of two powerline devices are required to establish a powerline connection. If you are uncertain about your network conditions, you should consult an IT professional to assist in selecting a networking product. Maximum wireless transmission rates are the physical rates derived from IEEE Standard 802.11 specifications. Range and coverage specifications along with the number of connected devices were defined according to test results under normal usage conditions.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.0 4.0 out of 5 stars 487 ratings 4.0 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Easily Extend Fast, Reliable Wired and WiFi to Every Room The TL-WPA7617 KIT transforms your home’s existing electrical circuit into a fast network. It brings wired and wireless networks to anywhere there is a power outlet 1. No need for new wires or drilling. 2. Network passes through walls and floors. 3. Compatible with any WiFi routers and other TP-Link powerline products. 4. Expand coverage by adding more extenders. *Please note that powerline adapters must be deployed in sets of two or more and be connected to the same electrical circuit
Gigabit Ethernet for Reliable Connections One Gigabit Ethernet port provides warp-speed wired connections for 4K HD streaming, lag-free gaming, and more. *Two Ethernet cables are included in the box.

Plug and Play, No Configuration Required Ditch the complicated setup process for good and get started with powerline in just 2 steps: Step 1: connect TL-PA7017P to your router Step 2: plug in TL-WPA7617 wherever you need wired and wireless internet service. *Pair for more security: Press the “Pair” button on each adapter for create a more secure network. *Powerline adapters need to be connected to the same electrical circuit

One-Touch Wi-Fi Configuration Instantly copies the wireless network name (SSID) and password from your router by pressing the WiFi Clone button. Besides, any changes made to the WiFi settings of any powerline adapter will be automatically applied across the entire Powerline network.

OneMesh for Seamless Whole-Home Streaming With OneMesh technology, you can effortlessly create a Mesh network with a single network name for uninterrupted streaming when moving from room to room. Connect the TL-WPA7617 to a OneMesh router for seamless roaming experience managed from the TP-Link Tether app. (update to the latest firmware)

Powerline Management on Your Smartphone Manage your powerline Wi-Fi through tpPLC app from your smartphone(Android, iOS), or download new tpPLC utility on PCs to manage the powerline network • View real time powerline speed • LED control (also controlled by LED on/off button) • Guest network

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Using it in the 3-rd country
reviews.reviewText: I've been using TP-Link powerline extenders for about 5 years in 3 different countries with 3 different standards of the outlets and electricity (UK, Middle East, now USA) and it always worked seamlessly. This time in the USA the setup is fully automated - literally plug and play, you don't even need to press a button. I was surprised that this time there is a zero loss of speed, before it was not transmitting full speed over powerline, now the speed is exactly the same as from the main router. And powerline extender is totally superior vs wireless extender. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My internet company removed the cables in my apartment and installed a wireless modem. My televisions worked okay, but my computer became extremely slow. After complaining and two technicians' separate repair efforts, the second technician threw in the towel and suggested installing a Powerline extender like this one. It was simple to install and it works like a charm! (Darned cable company won't credit me for this, but I'm happy that my computer speed is up to par!)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great once you get it set up
reviews.reviewText: Connected fine right out of the box following the included instructions but had no internet connection. Chatted with help desk, but that was a slow process. I figured out on my own while chatting with the help desk that I needed to configure a manual connection to the extender before I could connect to the internet. Once I figured that out, signal was great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Would not waste your time with this, better effort would go towards making a mesh wifi network
reviews.reviewText: I had high hopes for this after reading some of the reviews. After getting the unit, they paired pretty quickly in the same room. Wifi speed as at most 45mb/s so decided to try wired. Wired at most was 45mb/s :(Upgraded the firmware hoping that it would be better. The tplink management web interface said it had negotiated "150mb/s" for powerline.Tried multiple different plugs throughout the house and it got consistently worse. It did not connect back to the master unit by my media center when plugged directly into the wall. Tried a few different bedrooms and it didn't work either. Found a single plug in the kitchen where it did work, but at this location only got 4mb/s.Nowhere near the rated speed of 1000mb/s in the specs. Best to avoid this and save yourself trouble. For comparison, i get 500mb/s speedtest using the wireless mesh network (5ghz) which is the limit of my internet speed. Was hoping to use this where the wireless coverage is lacking or too far, but will have to come up with something else.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seems to work for what I needed
reviews.reviewText: One room in my house gets awful wifi reception despite being only about 30 feet from an access point with only one interior wall as obstacle. This definitely solved the spotty wifi for the smart tv in this room but speed was nowhere close to the 400mb service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Slower speeds but good enough for me
reviews.reviewText: I used this to get internet into a pole barn that is a good ways from my home. Speeds inside my house are around 800 mbps. Speed inside my shop is around 50. Didn't expect it to be 800 that far away but 50 is good enough to do what I need out there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars MUCH slower than advertised, and Amazon shipped me a used one
reviews.reviewText: I wanted Internet access in my workshop - it's two floors below my WiFi access point and between the flooring, ductwork and so forth, I've had little luck getting a reliable signal there. I don't need massive speed, so my first thought was powerline networking. I've had good luck with TP-Link powerline products in the past, so I figured I'd try it.The biggest problem I had was that the product I received was obviously returned by a previous owner. I can say this definitively because instead of using the default SSID and password on the label, it was configured to the SSID "DavesGarage" with an unknown password...clearly, someone had deployed this product and returned it to Amazon, but nothing in the product description told me I was paying for a used product.I was also surprised at the performance limitations of this device. I have an older TP-Link powerline adapter that works well, but lacks WiFi (it's just two wired gigabit ethernet ports). I get about 700 megabits to this device and that's more than enough for my needs. I was expecting this newer WPA7617 to be as fast or faster, but that's not the case.On the wired ports of the WPA7617, I'm getting about 100 megabits - maybe 10% of the advertised speed. Connected to WiFi, I get about 30 megabits on the 2.4 GHz band, and about 50 megabits on the 5.0 GHz band. I thought perhaps the issue was the location where I have the device, so I moved the WPA6717 to the same location where I have my other powerline adapter and unplugged the older one. No change - still roughly 10% of the promised throughput. I also tried moving my older TP-Link receiver to my workshop, and it did fine there - about 700 megabits.Thinking it might be a problem to have two separate powerline networks going, I also tried pairing the receiver in the WPA7617 kit with my existing powerline network...again, no chancg in performance. I was impressed that this configuration worked (that is, one sender connecting to two receivers), but it didn't seem to make a difference from a performance perspective.Other negatives I'll mention are that the device runs a bit hot, it's big enough to block both outlets in a normal junction box, and it doesn't support any of the recent WiFi standards. There's no 802.11AC, AX, etc...the latest you get is 802.11n - a 15-year old standard that emerged in 2008.On the positive side, it is fairly inexpensive and once I understood how to reset the device back to factory defaults to clear the configuration that the previous owner had set, the setup process went smoothly. I had it up and running in just a few minutes, and the connection seemed to be solid (albeit slow).In summary, I suppose the fact that I was shipped a used product masquerading as new isn't TP-Link's fault...I'll blame Amazon for that one. But dramatically slower performance than advertised is troubling, and even though that's not necessarily a show-stopper for me,I just can't recommend this product. I'd definitely recommend trying other brands instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Work great. Installed on a concrete old house and it works great.
Funcionan excelente, facil instalacion. Me da una buena velocidad de conexión
Tengo una red estable y con la misma velocidad que tengo contratado, estando a 2 pisos de distancia donde esta el servicio de internet con fibra óptica

no cumple con lo descrito en la publicacion, tenicamente el producto esta diseñado para repetir un servicio de internet como maximo 300 MBps en 2.4GHz y 867MBps en 5GHz.y mi servicio me lo amplio a 90 MBps en fin no cumplio como imagine

reviews.reviewTitle: De lo mejor que hay en el mercado
reviews.reviewText: Se puede resumir en qué es un equipo fácil de usar, sencillo en su conexión y de muy buena calidad
